alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:28PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL UNION AND EAST CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM MDT... At 327 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Capulin, or 10 miles southwest of Des Moines, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grenville and Capulin. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 376 and 383, and between Mile Markers 389 and 403. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County
